activities.title: Regulatory Interface Launched
activities.description: Welcome to British Columbia’s website providing details about the environmental assessment process, permitting, regulatory oversight and compliance procedures as it relates to LNG Canada and the Coastal GasLink pipeline.

activities.title: Pipeline Permit Amended
activities.description: The BC Oil and Gas Commission provided Coastal GasLink with an approved amendment to re-route a 41-kilometre portion of their pipeline.

activities.title: Inspection Completed
activities.description: The BC Environmental Assessment Office’s inspection record for a site visit conducted March 21, 2019. The report identifies three minor incidences of non-compliance.

activities.title: Enforcement Order Issued
activities.description: Enforcement order requiring Coastal GasLink to provide appropriate notice to registered trapline holders and cease activities under specific conditions.

activities.title: Enforcement Order Issued
activities.description: Enforcement order requiring Coastal GasLink to fully conduct habitat assessments and propose mitigation to address adverse effects to plants and ecological communities.

activities.title: Management Plan Submitted
activities.description: Coastal GasLink’s contingency plans (appendix C) submitted.

activities.title: Management Plan Submitted
activities.description: Coastal GasLink’s mitigation and monitoring plans (appendix E) submitted.

activities.title: Warning Letter Issued
activities.description: Letter identifying activity that started before the required notification was sent to the BC Oil and Gas Commission.

activities.title: Compliance Self-Reported
activities.description: LNG Canada’s self-report providing a status of compliance with the conditions outlined in the project’s environmental assessment certificate.

activities.title: Inspection Report Filed
activities.description: The BC Environmental Assessment Office’s field and administrative inspection report of work underway at the LNG Canada export site.
